questions.text: Select the wrongly matched pair of excipients and vaccines.
questions.solution:
Formaldehyde is not used in the BCG vaccine. It is used in IPV and diphtheria and tetanus vaccines. 

Excipients (other vaccine constituents) include: Adjuvants: serve to enhance the immune reaction to the vaccine , Stabilizers : stabilize and prolong the shelf-life of the vaccine  and 

Preservatives : preserve the components. Some examples are listed below:

  • As stabilizing agents-
    • MgCl2 - OPV
    • MgSO4 - measles
    • Lactose-sorbitol and sorbitol-gelatine
  • To prevent microbial growth and contamination-
    • Thiomersal- DPT, hepatitis B, Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib), rabies, influenza, and meningococcal diseases. It contains very small amounts of organic mercury.
    • Neomycin- MMR and IPV
  • Other preservatives-
    • 2-phenoxyethanol - IPV
    • Phenol - Typhoid vaccine

questions.text: Which of the following is false about adjuvants in vaccines?

choices.text: Immune response is increased by degree or duration by their use
They are used in HPV vaccines
There is a high incidence of side effects with their use
They help in the reduction of amount of immunogens in vaccines

questions.solution:
Side effects are rare with the use of adjuvants in vaccines. 

Adjuvants are substances that are added to vaccines to enhance their immunogenicity by degree and/or duration. They help in the reduction of the amount of immunogen in vaccines or in the number of doses required to achieve immunity.

Aluminium salts are the most commonly used adjuvants.

Adjuvants are used in many vaccines like:

  • Anthrax vaccine
  • Hep A vaccine
  • Hep B vaccine
  • Japanese encephalitis vaccine
  • DT and DTaP
  • HPV vaccine
  • Pneumococcal vaccine

questions.text: Which adjuvant is used in the DPT vaccine?
questions.solution:
Aluminium is the adjuvant used in DPT vaccines.

The table below lists adjuvants used in human vaccines: 

Name

Class

Components

Vaccine

Alum

Mineral salts

Aluminium phosphate, aluminium hydroxide

Diphtheria, tetanus, pneumococcus, HAV, HBV, anthrax, tick-borne encephalitis, MenC, HPV

MF59

Oil-in-water emulsion

Squalene, Tween 80, Span 85

Seasonal and pandemic influenza

AS03

Oil-in-water emulsion

Squalene, Tween 80, alpha tocopherol

Pandemic influenza

AF03

Oil-in-water emulsion

Squalene, Montane 80, Eumulgin B1PH

Pandemic influenza

Virosomes

Liposomes

Phospholipids, cholesterol, haemagglutinin

Seasonal influenza, HAV

AS04

Alum-adsorbed TLR4 agonist

Alumnium hydroxide, monophosphoryl lipid A (MPL)

HBV, HPV

RC-529

Alum-adsorbed TLR4 agonist

Aluminium hydroxide, synthetic MPL

HBV

questions.text: A child has come to you for the administration of the IPV vaccine, as part of his routine immunisation schedule. Which of the following antibiotics may be found in this vaccine?
questions.solution:
IPV may contain trace amounts of streptomycin, neomycin or polymyxin B. 

MMR contain small amount of neomycin. 

Antibiotics are used during vaccine manufacture to prevent bacterial contamination of tissue culture cells.

questions.text: Which of the following are the most and least heat-sensitive vaccines respectively?

choices.text: Sabin vaccine and hep B vaccine
Japanese encaphalitis vaccine and pneumococcal vaccine
Salk vaccine and hep B vaccine

questions.solution:
Oral polio (Sabin) vaccine is the most heat-sensitive vaccine. Hepatitis B vaccines are the least heat-sensitive alongside meningococcal A vaccine, freeze-dried Hib vaccine and pneumococcal vaccines.

Vaccine sensitivity to freezing:

Rotavirus(liquid)< T,DT,dT< IPV < Hib(liquid)< HepB < Pentavalent <DTaP

Vaccines not damaged by freezing:

  • Yellow fever
  • BCG
  • Hib
  • Japanese encephalitis(live and inactivated)
  • Measles, mumps, rubella
  • OPV
  • Rabies
  • Rotavirus(Freeze-dried)
  • Varicella zoster

questions.text: Which of the following vaccines should be protected from sub-zero temperatures?
questions.solution:
Hepatitis B vaccine is sensitive to freezing and should be protected from sub-zero temperatures.

Vaccines to be protected from freezing are as follows:

  • Hepatitis B
  • Cholera
  • DTaP-hepB-Hib-IPV (hexavalent)
  • DTwP-hepB-Hib (pentavalent)
  • Liquid Hib
  • IPV
  • Influenza, pneumococcal vaccines
  • Tetanus, DT, Td
  • Rotavirus (freeze-dried, least sensitive), the liquid form is resistant to freezing
  • HPV

questions.text: What vaccines are supplied in the type of bottle given below?
questions.solution: The image shows an amber-colored vial. Vaccines like BCG and measles vaccine are sensitive to light and thus are supplied in such vials.

questions.text: Which of the following is a non-electrical cold-chain equipment?
questions.solution:
Cold boxes, vaccine carriers, and ice packs are some of the non-electrical components of the cold-chain system.

Cold boxes are insulated containers used for transportation and temporary storage of vaccines and ice packs. Vaccine carriers are usually not used for the storage of vaccines but for their transportation. Ice packs generally have two holes in them for placing vaccines. They are filled with water.

The below image shows a cold box containing vaccines and ice packs.

Related Pearl: Cold Chain Equipment

Cold chain equipment : 

Storage : 

  • Walk in cooler (WIC)
  • Walk in freezer (WIF)
  • Ice lined refrigerator (ILR)
  • Deep freezer 
  • Domestic refrigerator 

Solar :

  • Solar Refrigerator Battery drive
  • Solar Refrigerator Direct drive

Non electrical :

  • Cold box
  • Vaccine carrier

Transportation : 

  • Refrigerator vaccine van
  • Insulated vaccine van
  • Cold box 
  • Vaccine carrier

Has different temperature zones for different vaccines

Front Load Refrigerator (Domestic)

+2 to +8

Sub-district levels, hospitals. dispensaries and nursing homes

Used for all vaccines

questions.text: What is the temperature maintained in the freezer compartment of the solar refrigerator battery drive?
questions.solution:
The freezer compartment of the solar refrigerator battery drive is maintained at – 7 °C, and it is used to store mainly ice packs.

The vaccine storage compartment of this solar cold chain equipment is maintained at 2 to 8 °C. The other solar cold-chain equipment commonly used is the solar refrigerators direct drive, which uses the sun’s energy to freeze phase-change materials like water and then uses this formed ice bank to keep the refrigerator cold.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is not true about the device shown in the image below?

choices.text: Smaller ones are given to PHCs and the larger ones to district vaccine stores
They have temperature zones for different vaccines
Kata thermometer is used to record temperature inside this device
These devices are provided with baskets to store vaccines

questions.solution:
The image shown in the question is of an ice-lined refrigerator (ILR). Dial or digital thermometers are used to record temperatures inside an ice-lined refrigerator.

ILRs are the main method of vaccine storage in primary health centers. They are an important part of the cold chain and they maintain a temperature of 2 to 8 °C for the storage of vaccines.

They have different temperature zones for different vaccines. The upper zone is for freeze-sensitive vaccines like cholera, hep B, rotavirus(liquid), etc while the lower zone is for heat-sensitive vaccines like OPV, measles, etc.

All vaccines are kept in the basket provided with ILR. Vaccines like OPV, BCG, measles, and JE can be kept at the bottom of the basket while, DPT, TT, Hep B, IPV, and pentavalent vaccines and diluents are kept in the upper part of the basket.

questions.text: While working as a medical officer in a CHC, you experience a sudden power cut in your area due to which the ice-lined refrigerator loses power. What is the time taken for the temperature inside this equipment to rise to the maximum recommended temperature limit?
questions.solution:
Hold-over time is the time taken by cold-chain equipment to raise the temperature inside it, during loss of power, to the maximum temperature limit in its recommended range. For an ice-lined refrigerator(ILR), this time depends on:

  • Ambient temperature
  • Frequency of opening the equipment
  • Quantity of vaccines kept inside with spacing
  • Condition of ice-pack lining

The below image shows an ILR.

questions.text: At what level is the risk of cold-chain failure the highest?
questions.solution: The risk of cold chain failure is highest at the sub-centre and village levels. Thus, vaccines are not stored at the sub-centre and are supplied on the day of use.

questions.text: Open vial policy is not applicable to which of the following vaccines?
questions.solution:
Open vial policy is not applicable for BCG and measles vaccines.

It is applicable for:

  • DPT
  • TT
  • Hepatitis B vaccine
  • OPV
  • Pentavalent vaccine
  • Rotavirus vaccine (New version with the VVM on the side)

Related Pearl: Open Vial Policy

Open vial policy allows for reuse of partially used multidose vials of applicable vaccines under the Universal Immunization Programme in subsequent sessions up to 4 weeks subject to certain conditions and thereby reducing vaccine wastage.

It is applicable only for DPT, TT, hepatitis B vaccine, OPV, liquid pentavalent vaccine, rotavirus vaccine(new version with the VVM on the side), and JE vaccines (inactivated). It is not applicable to BCG and measles vaccines. 

Vaccine vials opened in session-site can be used in more than one session up to four weeks if expiry date has not passed, if storage and transport was appropriate, no contamination has occurred in vial septum, asepsis in withdrawing was practiced and if vaccine vial monitor has not reached discard point.

Open vials should not be submerged in water. All open vials should have a record of date and time of opening. At the end of a session, all vaccines should be returned to the cold chain point and segregated as re-usable and non-reusable. All open vials of BCG, measles must be destroyed after 48 hours or before next session, whichever is earlier.

In case of any adverse events following immunization, all open vials should not be discarded until investigation is complete. All vials must be transported in zipper bags in the vaccine carrier and recorded in stock register. Ice packs used should be well sealed.

questions.text: What are the devices given below used to measure?

choices.text: Disintegration of vaccine constituents due to temperature

questions.solution:
The image shown is of vaccine vial monitors (VVM), which measure the cumulative heat exposure of the vaccine.

VVMs are heat-sensitive indicators that are routinely used to monitor vaccine viability as the vaccine vial moves across the supply chain. They record cumulative heat exposure through a gradual change in color. If the color of the inner square is the same or is darker than the outer circle, the vaccine has been exposed to too much heat and should be discarded.

Related Pearl: Vaccine Vial Monitors

  • Vaccine vial monitors are used to monitor heat exposure of vaccines.
  • It is a chemical indicator that records the cumulative heat exposure through a gradual change in color.
  • If the color of the inner square is the same color or darker than the outer circle, it indicates that the vaccine has been exposed to too much heat and it must be discarded.
  • Currently, there are four types of VVMs (VVM2, VVM7, VVM14, and VVM30). They are chosen to match the heat sensitivity of the vaccine.
  • The VVM can be located on the label of the vaccine or on the neck or cap of the ampule/vial.
  • VVMs also help in reduction of vaccine wastage by indicating which batch of vaccines can be used first.

questions.text: ​​You are preparing to administer the BCG vaccine to a newborn at a PHC. Before administering the vaccine, you check the vaccine vial monitor. In which of the following observations on the VVM, will you discard the vaccine?

choices.text: Inner square has the same color as the outer circle
Inner circle has the same color as the outer square
Inner circle is lighter than the outer square

questions.solution:
A vaccine must be discarded if the VVM shows the inner square is the same color or darker than the outer circle.

Related Pearl: Vaccine Vial Monitors

  • Vaccine vial monitors are used to monitor heat exposure of vaccines.
  • It is a chemical indicator that records the cumulative heat exposure through a gradual change in color.
  • If the color of the inner square is the same color or darker than the outer circle, it indicates that the vaccine has been exposed to too much heat and it must be discarded.
  • Currently, there are four types of VVMs (VVM2, VVM7, VVM14, and VVM30). They are chosen to match the heat sensitivity of the vaccine.
  • The VVM can be located on the label of the vaccine or on the neck or cap of the ampule/vial.
  • VVMs also help in reduction of vaccine wastage by indicating which batch of vaccines can be used first.

questions.text: Which of the following vaccine vials can be used based on the vaccine vial monitor (VVM) color changes shown?
questions.solution:
From the above image, only vials 1 and 2 can be used as the inner squares of the VVMs are lighter than the outer circles.

Vial 3 has crossed the discard point as the inner square and outer circle are the same color and thus cannot be used. Vial 4 cannot be used as the VVM shows a darker inner square compared to the outer circle.

Related Pearl: Vaccine Vial Monitors

  • Vaccine vial monitors are used to monitor heat exposure of vaccines.
  • It is a chemical indicator that records the cumulative heat exposure through a gradual change in color.
  • If the color of the inner square is the same color or darker than the outer circle, it indicates that the vaccine has been exposed to too much heat and it must be discarded.
  • Currently, there are four types of VVMs (VVM2, VVM7, VVM14, and VVM30). They are chosen to match the heat sensitivity of the vaccine.
  • The VVM can be located on the label of the vaccine or on the neck or cap of the ampule/vial.
  • VVMs also help in reduction of vaccine wastage by indicating which batch of vaccines can be used first.

questions.text: You are volunteering in a vaccination camp. You perform a shake test before administering a particular vaccine. Which of the following is checked by this test?
questions.solution:
The shake test is done to check for damage to vaccines that are sensitive to freezing temperatures.

Steps to perform the shake test:

  • A frozen vaccine is used as a control vial and the vial suspected to be damaged by freezing is taken as the test vial.
  • Both are shaken after thawing and the rate of sedimentation is compared.
  • If the rate of sedimentation in the test vial is slower than that in the control vial, then it is usable and has not been damaged.

Some of the most widely used vaccines are freeze-sensitive. These include vaccines against:

  • Diphtheria
  • Tetanus
  • Pertussis
  • Haemophilus influenza type b (Liquid )
  • Hepatitis B

Related Pearl: Temperature Sensitivity of Vaccines

B Influenza

Pneumococcal
